Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jensta007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and were very happy with the location, although on arrival were very dubious as the entrance is practically a doorway in a small street. Our room was tiny, on opening the door you were practically already on the bed, which was pushed against the opposite wall. The bathroom however was spacious and very clean. There was no refrigerator in our room which I find inconvenient as I take medication that requires refrigeration. We were located on the 6th floor and were only a meter or so away from the elevator which meant that you could clearly hear late night guests walking along the corridor which was not carpeted,and you could also hear their conversations as they walked by, the walls seemed to be paper thin! The elevator motor was also audible, not the best room for a quite nights sleep! On a positive note, the 6Euro breakfast was good for the price, providing more than your usual bread and pastries.Overall this place was very clean, but small, I was not happy about the level of "internal"noise, but maybe that was just the room we had. The location was great and as we were only in the room for a short time each night it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: xcz
Reviews.Content: Spent a few very pleasant days here. Our room was small (but not too small), stylish, and clean, with a small balcony, and a view over the lively square at Barcelona Museum of Contemporary Art.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, charged me twice.”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October, the staff was friendly and the room was small but clean and fine and the hotel well located. I am only unhappy with the hotel because my credit card was charged for an extra night and when I disputed it with VISA, the hotel still contested and would not refund my extra charge of 133$. If you stay here, pay in cash, watch your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Cold but not bad value”
Reviews.Author: Zumo2110
Reviews.Content: The experience could have been better! The room heating wasn't working and it was very cold in the room. Asked at reception if it could be looked at, was told not possible until the next day. Told the hotel was full but might be able to change rooms tomorrow. Given two blankets. The impression given by the staff member was indifferent "No one else has complained".. but I hadn't said that I thought the heating wasn't working in all the rooms. The heater made a noise but no air came out....... I do know when something isn't working! On returning the next day, an electrician was in our room. He said that the heating was broken and that we should be given another room. Reception initially offered a twin room. I declined that and mysteriously a double was then available. This room was fine. As we exited the lift next day, the indifferent receptionist was handing out blankets to two guests! Bet they'd been given room 201! Having said this, if you get a warm room, the hotel isn't bad. Clean and modern, rooms are small but the price is good. Breakfast was ok, a cold buffet. Well sited for The Ramblas. The trip was also memorable because my patner had her Kindle stolen in a cafe. I'd seen the guy acting suspiciously and ran after him and got it back! Be warned(but Barcelonas probably no worse than any other big city for this)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowPatricia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights Jan 2012. Our first sight of the narrow street when we arrived at night was a little off-putting but we encountered no problems at all during our stay. Indeed the bars and restaurants were very pleasant. We had 2 lovely meals in a local restaurant recommended by the hotel.The location of the hotel is great for access to Metro, airport bus and within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas. I agree with a previous reviewer who commented on how clean the hotel was. All areas were spotless. The staff were friendly and helpful; free wi-fi was a plus, as was the fact that we could leave our luggage there for later pick up. There was some street noise as you would expect in a working city location but nothing to complain about and inside the hotel was very quiet.We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: sandocious
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute reservation as we had to stay additional night in Barcelona. Honestly, the location was not the greatest [please note: please be aware of your surroundings outside of the hotel] but it is within walking distance of a lot of shopping and underground metro. The Hotel and rooms are nice and clean. Staff was great and very helpful and Wifi was free. The rooms were a little small but it wasn't a big deal to us. This hotel listed as a 2 Star.. I think it's underrated.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: redcat777
Reviews.Content: Some might say that the location of this hotel was sketchy, however, we are from NYC, so the multiethnic neighborhood was fabulous. It was close to all transportation, right in the center of the Barri Gotic, and within walking distance of many major attractions. The room and bath were basic, however, they were SPOTLESS, and the breakfast room was the same, offering a lovely selection. The front desk was most helpful and spoke very good English a plus, since Spanish is NOT the language of Barcelona. Wifi is free and reaches all rooms...fab. I would recommend this hotel for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay - one room very good, the other less so”
Reviews.Author: JPS_in_WGS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights before our cruise. We took 2 rooms. A twin for my father and my daughter and a double for my wife and I. We arrived late on the Thursday evening and we were given two rooms next to each other on the 5th floor. The twin room was large wiith a balcony and a spacious bathroom including bath. The double was tiny - not much bigger than their bathroom. However, we were only using it as a place to sleep and we got a special cruise price so we didn't complain. The area doesn't look the best (as mentioned in other reviews), but we had no problems and it is nice and central. If you want something cheap, cheerful and central I would recommend it (as long as you get one of the bigger rooms!!)

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous, seedy area. Unsafe at night. No security”
Reviews.Author: Crackajack1
Reviews.Content: Terrible place with tiny rooms although fairly clean. The noise is horrendous at night. Screaming and domestics on the street. A fight with ( non anglo people) spilled into the hotel to the 4 th level on our first night. Smashing on doors and walls. A disgusting place. Do not bring your children to this area. You can get better accommodation around the corner for the same price. We were afraid to stay there so we moved.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: radioharris
Reviews.Content: Staff is kind, location is very good near the university and the art comtemporary muséum, some bars and many people in the streets the night. Maybe a bit noisy but it was ok! A place where I'll return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Thorsten27
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay in this hotel which is located directly in the city centre of barcelona. Walking distance to the ramblas and other tourist places. THe room was VERY small and not very soundproof.. but thats ok for a city hotel where you only spent the nights. staff was ok and was able to give some nice recommendations. The Aerobus from the airport stops in walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice,clean hotel to stay closed to center”
Reviews.Author: eva888Athens
Reviews.Content: the area is crowded and looks not so safe...but has a nice character and is recommended for young ppl as it is full of bars and very close to city center walking....the hotel is simple, nice and very clean...the breakfast buffet is good and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in upcoming area, great value”
Reviews.Author: Meeuwis_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this small, modern hotel. For a 2 star hotel we thought it perfect: rooms are clean, large and clean bathrooms, beds are okay, airco, TV with multiple channels, free internet acces in room, small safe, big cupboard, basic but okay breakfast, nice staff. Situated in a busy area with the museum of modern art in the back, as well as some university buildings and with small bars and restaurants in the front. The area and surroundings are 'busy', therefore at night you hear street sounds. In the back you hear skateboarders which skate around the museum of modern art. At 3 a.m. the whole block in front of this museum is cleaned with a large machine. In the front of the hotel you'll find people from the cafes and restaurants hanging out. All sounds that are common in big cities. With windows closed (and airco when needed) it is 'do-able'! We have not felt unsafe around the hotel, just loved all the people walking by, enjoyed the nice and good cafes and restaurants nearby. We felt safe at all times, even though we saw about 7 police officers pick up 2 guys Sundaymorning, 6.30 am...!. There are lots of police officers everywhere and it is a big city. Something you will need to consider in any city. From the hotel it is easy to walk to all the places down town you want to see; perfect location in an upcoming area with lots of small (second hand & vintage) shops, lots of barbers and small (multi cultural) restaurants. Front rooms face the busy, narrow street with bars and restaurants (numbers 5,6,7). The rooms in the back of the hotel either face a blind wall (less noise??) or look out on the square in front of the Modern Art museum (1, 2, 3). Top floor and the back side of the hotel is the best / most quiet (we think). But... it is a busy city, so expect to hear a lot of what is going on outside..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: AnaCornwall
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my parrtner for a short city break, I previously before booking read reviews from other travellers and was impressed. For the money I paid we had outstanding quality far better than ever expected. Breakfast was lovely and we had lots of choice, the hotel is spotless, rooms are cleaned daily and they are very spacious. Staff are very helpful. Barcelona is a wonderfull city but for anyone wishing to visit you do need to be aware of colourful characters hanging around the narrow streets particularly the street where the hotel is located although it is city centre location which you couldn't ask for more the street can make you feel a little bit uneasy especially at night. Just be aware of your bags avoid having them on show. I certainly would not hesitate to recommend Barcelona and this hotel as we had a lovely time & experience but just have your wits about you!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: alexzha
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, very clean. staff is great. free internet, deposit box and baggage keeping. we checked out at 12 and our flight was in the night. we left our bags their for almost a day for free. breakfast is very basic. the sorroundings might not seem very friendly but they just looking for stupid tourist. not violent. and the polive is everywhere. so dont be afraid great location just 5 minutes from la rambla and placa catalunia. walkind distance to two different metro lines. the aero bus (frim airport) is also stopping on placa catalunia so getting from airport is very easy.

Reviews.Title: “a simple two star in a soso area”
Reviews.Author: fzngr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the old (poor) part of Barcelona close to the macba. It is a small hotel over several floors, recently renovated. The rooms are small, but modern. I could hear everything on the floor while sleeping. The breakfast offer the minimum necessary; the receptionist was always friendly and helpful. As you need to watch-out in the street and area I would not chose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: irishfamilyIreland
Reviews.Content: Went to see the European T&F Championships, and found that this hotel was an ideal location not only to see the Europeans but great foe seeing the city and eating out. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “what a shame”
Reviews.Author: Garinca
Reviews.Content: Despite we couldn’t come to Barcelona because our flight was canceled (becouse of volcanic ash cloud) the hotel charged our credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel it is very clean and close to centre.”
Reviews.Author: edinburghmisty
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 8 days at this hotel and really enjoyed our stay. We were at the front of hotel and we had a small balcony, great to watch the street life ! This is not a quite street so when you open the doors the street comes into your room ,but this is Barcelona if you like quite then close the doors ! The hotel is comfy and very clean, we didn't have breakfast so can't comment. Rooms aren't large but for a city break they were addiquite, there was plenty storage for your clothes. If I was going to have a complaint then it would be that there was no kettle in room, but we knew this and took our own. We went to Girona for the day ,a nice day out and easy to reack in an hour and a half. The last thing a would like to touch on is the crime in Barcelona, do not be afraid to go as I never once saw any violence but do watch out for pickpockets. On our second night 2 metres from hotel we were targeted, he asked us where we were from then did we like judo. He then started to look for my husbands black belt, we realised what he was after and just pushed him away and that was that but it all happened very quickly. Dont be put of just don't carry to much money and keep your wits about you and it will be fine. Anyway i'm going on a little but when i was searching for a hotel I wanted all the truth , then you can be prepared , Barcelona is lovely and I will return in a few years to see there famous monument and see how its progressing. Young couple in their 50's :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieBrighton
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Acta in Barcelona for three nights at the end of March beginning of April 2010. I had read a lot of reviews on different hotels of where to stay in Barcelona - many people complained of the noise in hotels and that the breakfasts in some hotels were expensive and not up to scratch. I then stumbled across reviews for Hotel Acta, which were very good, hence I had high expectations. I have to say could not fault a thing with the hotel. Staff were helpful, it was spotlessly clean and the breakfasts were excellent. There was some noise in the evenings at the back of the hotel where our room was situated with kids skateboarding but this was not a problem for us, as we were far too tired from sightseeing etc during the day. The hotel is around a 5 minute walk to the Ramblas, which was great! All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back to this hotel again. It was an excellent choice and exceeds a two star hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “clean,pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: san18
Reviews.Content: The Acta 40 is a small,clean hotel. The street is safe and always has people walking around day and night. The hotel staff are extremely helpful,mapping out places and giving suggestions. The hotel is about 4 blocks off the Ramblas. The breakfast served is in a lovely clean room. Cold breakfast with turkey,cheese,rolls,coffee etc.The room has a small flat screen tv that only has one English channel..CNN Select a lower floor for good WiFi connection in the room. There is a free computer in the small hotel lobby. The room is very clean with a small desk and queen size bed. Large bathroom..bring your own tissues.If you email the hotel with questions they respond quickly. There are lots of restaurants and food stores next door to the hotel. You can take the airport bus to the hotel and then walk or take a cab to the hotel.If you are looking for a cheap hotel, this one is an excellent pick.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: lamysafari
Reviews.Content: At this price level, this hotel is value for money. The address listed in trip advisor is incorrect. The correct address is Joaquin Costa 40.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than a "2*”
Reviews.Author: ashleej
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my best friend, we were after a really good central location but without paying for it! We opted for a 2* as much cheaper and didnt think we'd be spending much time in the hotel anyway. We were pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness and how modern it was. For two 19year old girls the outside street was a little intimidating and not the nicest however it was only about a 5-10 minute walk to La Rambla. The hotel staff were very friendly and we had plenty of choice for breakfast. I would definatley rate it more than 2*. The surrounding area was very busy especially in the square on an evening which was at the bottom of the street, seems like a popular place to skate and where all the locals hang out. We went on a tour bus for 2days which i would definatley suggest. We walked pretty much everywhere as theres so much to see and do on La Ramblas although we caught the bus to get to the beach - took about 10mins and is only $2! (beach is lovely aswell!) Plently of restaurants to choose and nice bars. Spanish men were very forward and a bit seedy but for those that travel europe/med will already be prepared for it! Shopping was great aswell! I would definatley recommend anyone wanting to explore the city to base themselves at this hotel. The standards were excellent, very stylish and exceeded expectations. I fell in love with barcelona and definatley will go back and most likely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really neat hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler25
Reviews.Content: We were expecting all sorts of unsavory characters in the street by the hotel but that was not the case. The folks in the street were the usual types found in a large city neighborhood---families, teens, old folks and couples. The hotel is very clean and the staff were helpful. La Rambla was only a couple of block away. However be prepared for the HORRIBLE amount of cigarette smoke in Barcelona. You cannot escape it. We will not go back to Spain until the locals have done something about this situation.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel also with infants”
Reviews.Author: yonye7
Reviews.Content: we would very like to recommend this hotel. the location is pretty central altough the neibourhood is not the best and there are a some frightening people there but we felt safe as we walked there with our 3 month old baby. the crew was wonderfull and handeled all our requests for the baby in the most polite and helpfull way. the room was very nice with wooden floor and a very comfortable bed. there was a little noise at night cause of the many bars and resteraunts on the street but we liked having so much action close by and the noise was not such an issue.there was also a free internet stand that was very availbale. a very good place for its price - we took it without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, close to all the action!”
Reviews.Author: Kooteraya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in 2007 when it was the 'Apsis 40' and returned as we liked it so much the first time we stayed. On our first stay we were given room 404, which had a view of a whitewashed wall the other side of a courtyard, the room was lovely and had a large bathroom but we wished we had been able to see outside! This time I emailed the hotel a few weeks before our stay to request a room overlooking the rear of the hotel and we were delighted upon arrival to be given the keys to room 501 with a view of MACBA (at the rear of the hotel). The room was even larger than the one we previously stayed in, and again had a well sized bathroom. There was some noise especially in the evenings as the area around MACBA becomes very busy with skateboarders but we enjoyed being so close to the hustle and bustle, and most of the noise was eliminated when the balcony doors were shut. There was also some additional noise on our second day and for the remainder of our stay when some builders arrived and started to dig a large trench in the square at the back of the hotel, they did however finish around 8pm every night so we did not find this a major problem. The room was cleaned and towels changed each day and we found the room was always spotless. We did notice that since our stay in 2007, the decor has aged slightly and there were areas in the room that could have done with a lick of paint, mainly where suitcases have knocked into the walls, and the mirror in the bathroom had some water damage to it, but this is the only bad thing I can find to write! We booked our room with breakfast and there was a fantastic selection of food every day, including cereals, meats, cheese, yoghurts, fruit, pastries, breads and cakes , available until 10am, so we were able to have a welcome lie in. Location was fantastic for exploring on foot, with La Rambla only a 5 minute walk away and lots of interesting narrow streets nearby with bars, restaurants and shops on the doorstep. Also only a 5 minute walk to 'Universitat' metro station which enabled quick and easy access to anywhere in this fantastic city. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel, some reviews mention the area around the hotel as dodgy, but I never felt that this was the case, it is just a typical Barcelona street, it was so busy at all hours of the day and night that we never felt vulnerable and we found the various staff in the local shops (very useful for buying drinks and supplies) extremely friendly and helpful. Great place, we will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience but...”
Reviews.Author: predino
Reviews.Content: It was overall a positive experience. I booked this hotel from a travel agency in Greece for 85 euros per day with breakfast (in their site they asked 100 for the same double room ). At first they provided us with a very-very-very small room and we asked a bigger one. The staff was so polite and they generally did everything to satisfy our needs. The breakfast was very good. The area was not so unsafe us i read to other reviews. We felt safety throughout our stay. The city centre is in the hotel-not near. All the life is around the hotel. However the position of the hotel and the construction made the rooms to be extremely noisy. We could not sleep after 8-8:30 in the morning. Overall i think it was a great stay but we could find something cheaper with the same facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gaudifantoo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay in Barcelona .We were attendng a conference had trouble finding a hotel.Booked the Acta BCN 40 and must say this was the best situation I have ever had in Barcelona.The Hotel is very friendly ,rooms clean well furnished with very nice ensuites,fantastic choice at breakfast.For a budget hotel this was special as we really liked being in with the locals-not touristy at all.There are some great restaurants and bars just outside the door and you wont be ripped off.We shall definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with strange surrounding”
Reviews.Author: ayakrugzo
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the hotel staff was great. Breakfast was fine but since we wanted to be a part of Barça, we only once ate at hotel. When we were in Barça, there was a festival called St. Juan. So there were a lot of firework and noise on the first night. But after it was quite silent. Hotel is situated very close to La Rambla.It's very easy to walk to Rambla. Rates of the hotel is quite suitable. Long story short, i reccomend to this hotel to the people who travel with their friend or as couple not to the families because of the surrounding (enviroment) of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider”
Reviews.Author: labarb2000
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning system emitted warm musty air; air intake vents filled with filthy lint; desk clerk did nothing to remedy situation; bad neighborhood; better choices close by including Meson Castilla around the corner; wonderful city; don't ruin your trip at this psuedo modernismo dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Inside but a Shabby Area, Lift kept breaking down”
Reviews.Author: Neil1966
Reviews.Content: The street outside the hotel looked very dodgy, i would not fancy walking around the area in the small hours especially for women. The hotel itself is great, very clean and bright in contrast to outside, the reception staff speak perfect English and are only too happy to help, the breakfast was excellent, with plenty of fruit, rolls, cold meats and cheese available, a wide selection of cakes was also included. There are loads of small shops and restaurant/bars in the street and if you turn left outside the hotel and walk toi the end of the street, take another left and you are at La Rambla easily within 7 - 8 mins. Barcelona has loads of things to do and this is a great base to explore from being within a few minutes of a Metro station which is a great method of getting around the city. Overall i would reccommend the Acta 40 but as the lift frequently broke down and we were on the 5th floor it was a bit of a pain. If you have mobility difficukties i would phone the hotel beforehand and request a lower floor room.

Reviews.Title: “I like the place, but.............”
Reviews.Author: Orbitspaw
Reviews.Content: Modern, ultra clean. The Apsis 40 has a very helpful staff. Is is well located within a ten minutre walK from La Rambla. There are many interesting shops and reataurants in the area. Public transportation is nearby. Here are a couple of minor gripes. The Apsis 40 is in a crowded transitional nieghborhood. During the evening hours the streets are full of mostly Asian and Eastern Eurpean men just "hanging out". It appears that they live in crowded rooming houses and have no other place to go. I saw NO threat frfom these guys but some visitors may be uncomfortable. The area is well policed. If your room is at the front of the hotel you will hear considerable noise from the street. Rooms on the sixth floor will get noise all night from the elevator machinery which is located there. I would have liked to have had a usesful reading lamp next to the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: k55_lol
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on a cheap city break. The room was booked through xcapewithus.com which we have used before and found reasonable and hassle free. Upon researching this hotel we found mixed reviews from previous visitors. However, we decided to book due to the fact that the cost was very low. We used the shuttlebus from the airport (7eur rtn) and found the hotel easily with the help of a map (multimap). The street which the hotel is situated does seem seedy but considering the time of year and being 2 females we never felt unsafe with the short walk down the street to the hotel. The reception staff man the entrance 24hrs and permit entrance to residents only. We found the location of the hotel ideal and walked easily to all the sights. 5-8min walk to Las Ramblas. The sink in our room leaked upon arrival and we informed reception staff approx 20min from check in. This was fixed that afternoon - excellent. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Room cleaned daily. The continental breakfast offered great variety and everything was fresh and well presented. We loved the modern rooms with small balconys, and free use of safety deposit box. Also you could access the internet for free if you wished in the reception area. I would use this hotel again, and feel it was worth every 'penny' we paid!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Acta BCN 40
HotelInfo.Address: Joaquin Costa, 40, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
